alert.note: Alert for Craven; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 10:37AM EDT until July 15 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Craven County in eastern North Carolina... Southeastern Pamlico County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 145 PM EDT. * At 1037 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Between 6 and 8 inches of rain have fallen across eastern Pamlico County including Merritt where flash flooding is already occurring. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Bern, Havelock, Florence, Janeiro, Whortonsville, Nc Pamlico, Merritt, Minnesott Beach Ferry, Cherry Branch Ferry Terminal, Arapahoe, Minnesott Beach, Vandemere and Mesic. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
